lines.text:
[In the cemetery, looking at all the elaborate tombs]
I don't care where they put me when I'm dead.
Do you think the soul escapes from the body after death? Is there such a thing as the soul?
I don't think there's anything left after physical death. And it's stupid to spend all that money on stiffs.
Some do that out of love.
Well, I prefer the love of life more than the love of death.

[Looking up at the stars, while in the cemetery]
They say that the stars are gods sending us signals.
